body_html: @gujinghui The mkl test failures are caused by cmake not installing all caffe2 files to the installation prefix (grep for "Installing" here https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/caffe2-builds/job/py2-mkl-ubuntu16.04-build/3287/consoleFull), and looks to me it's https://github.com/intel/ideep/blob/4841cf63086b8beab2fae53c1449bfed7188314e/CMakeLists.txt#L25 redefines "install" causing the problem.
body_text: @gujinghui The mkl test failures are caused by cmake not installing all caffe2 files to the installation prefix (grep for "Installing" here https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/caffe2-builds/job/py2-mkl-ubuntu16.04-build/3287/consoleFull), and looks to me it's https://github.com/intel/ideep/blob/4841cf63086b8beab2fae53c1449bfed7188314e/CMakeLists.txt#L25 redefines "install" causing the problem.
body: @gujinghui The mkl test failures are caused by cmake not installing all caffe2 files to the installation prefix (grep for "Installing" here https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/caffe2-builds/job/py2-mkl-ubuntu16.04-build/3287/consoleFull), and looks to me it's https://github.com/intel/ideep/blob/4841cf63086b8beab2fae53c1449bfed7188314e/CMakeLists.txt#L25 redefines "install" causing the problem.
